newsitem.title: USA: INSIGHT - Dollar limps meekly into weekend.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Dollar limps meekly into weekend.

text.p: The dollar failed to hold modest overnight gains, slumping toward session lows late Friday, though technical analysts said current medium-term ranges will probably hold for several more days.

Dollar/Europe continued to underperform dollar/yen as the mark/yen cross edged steadily higher. Mark/yen currently faces strong resistance at 72.90, but could rise toward medium-term goals at 73.30 and 73.80, chartists said.
"Above 72.55-60 mark/yen has broken back into a triangle pattern that had dominated from October through Feburary," said Chris Turner, senior technical analyst at IDEA.
"If you look back at the Fed rate hike on February 4, 1994, (the first of seven over 12 months) that essentially marked the top for the dollar," Johnson said.
Medium-term resistance stands at 1.7120 in dollar/mark, which held overnight, Johnson noted.
Against the yen, the greenback looks somewhat firmer than versus the mark, though a failed foray higher by dollar/yen early Friday suggests sideways trade in the immediate future.
"Dollar/yen was rejected at 124.10. That's not the most bullish thing in the world," said Johnson.
